item.title: Austrian vanilla crescents
item.description: You can substitute almond flour for the ground walnuts. Cut butter into ½ inch cubes, then set aside in the freezer to keep cold. Meanwhile prepare the rest of the ingredients. Weigh the flour and set aside in the freezer or fridge as well. The colder the ingredients, the better. Grind walnuts very finely with a mouli grater (I couldn’t find walnut meal). Don’t use a food processor, the chopped pieces will still come out too big.

item.title: Cauliflower steaks with roasted red pepper & olive salsa
item.description: Unlock the flavours of cauliflower with a red pepper, olive and caper salsa, topped with almonds. Healthy and vegan, it makes a tasty light lunch or supper. Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7 and line a baking tray with baking parchment. Slice the cauliflower into two 1-inch steaks – use the middle part as it’s larger, and save the rest for another time. Rub the paprika and 1⁄2 tbsp oil over the steaks and season.

item.title: Esquites
item.description: Mix all the ingredients in a glass. From Tako Away.

item.title: Griddled halloumi with watermelon & caper breadcrumbs
item.description: This salad has a great interplay of textures, temperatures and flavours. Toss juicy watermelon with salty cheese, crispy breadcrumbs, capers, almonds and mint. Cut the watermelon into either cubes or slices and transfer to a bowl with the very finely sliced shallots. Add 4 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and the balsamic, then season with fresh black pepper. Cover and put in the fridge for about 15-20 mins. Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan.

item.title: Lentils donettes
item.description: Quantities for 28 small donuts. Blend all the ingredients. Divide the mixture into a donut mold and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 18 minutes; or for 5 minutes in a donut maker. (Optional) Let cool and decorate with melted dark chocolate mixed with almond pieces. From Instagram @marisel.orozco.

item.title: Lime, physalis and elderflower caipiroska
item.description: Lime, Physalis and Elderflower Caipiroska Equipment 1 x Short Glass 1 x Crushed ice 1 x Jigger 1 x Muddler 1 x Chopping Board 1 x Knife Cut the lime in wedges, take out the white membrane, then cut the physalis in half and place in a glass. Muddle the lime, physalis with the Elderflower sugar syrup in the glass. With the muddler press down on the lime and physalis to extract flavor and juices.
